issue.body:
http://codepen.io/0101adm/full/wKpwMd/

without a User Agent override, tooltip closes on either click or mouseover on the trigger element.

with a UA override of "Mozilla/5.0 (iPhone; U; CPU iPhone OS 4_2_1 like Mac OS X; en-us) AppleWebKit/533.17.9 (KHTML, like Gecko) Version/5.0.2 Mobile/8C148 Safari/6533.18.5"... tooltip no longer closes.

this was working up to 0.11.4.

comment.body:
i have duplicated this on a phones browser.  chrome.

moto x2 / android 5.1

it doesnt necessarily hamper development.  i can refactor later.  it just doesnt close when focus leaves the trigger.

issue.title: md-dialog not closing anymore
issue.body:
With the latest HEAD the md-dialog does not close anymore.
it works in 0.11.3

md-background is hidden but dialog still stays.

issue.title: md-progress-circular has wrong animation in IE 11
issue.body:
md-progress-circular currently has a weird animation in IE when loaded for a second time. Open [this codepen](http://codepen.io/anon/pen/mejpjM) in IE and click the on/off switch a few times and the animation will go crazy.

Current behavior:
![2015-11-03_11-17-23](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/5230331/10905716/6c3852f6-821c-11e5-8273-442e94904ae9.gif)

Expected behavior:
![2015-11-03_11-15-57](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/5230331/10905696/3a930ad4-821c-11e5-9443-f8256578d53d.gif)

pull_request.title: chore(bundles): unify SFX bundles creation
pull_request.body:
This PR unifies sfx bundles creation to make it more in-line with other tasks. 

While this makes code cleaner (less duplication, easier to read - at least to me!) it also shows that our sfx story is as "broken" as CJS story:
* we've got only sfx bundles for core and http (and missing it for router, for example)
* http sfx bundle duplicates all (or at least most) of the code from ng2 core

My vote for the long-term solution would go for killing current sfx bundles in favor of UMD bundles that we are going to create as part of our CJS efforts.

pull_request.title: build(browserstack): add all supported browsers
pull_request.body: The job should fail as some tests are currently broken.

issue.title: feat(chips): add support for custom separator keys
issue.body:
Implements #5279 

Add the optional ability for chips to be created on keydown of any key
in the `md-separator-keys` attribute. Custom key codes are supported
in addition to common ones defined in `$mdConstant.KEY_CODE`.

comment.body: Refactored and updated demo and spec. I left the addition of the `COMMA` definition on the constant since it seems there would be a broad enough use case for this, but let me know if this should be removed in favor of a strictly generic approach.

issue.title: Proposal: Easy component rendering dynamically
issue.body:
It's easiest to explain what/why with a use case.

I have a "dashboard" application. The dashboard is used to render a number of different isolated components.

The problem is that which components are being rendered can change based on a number of different factors in the app. User preferences being one of them. Although only a handful of components will ever be rendered at one time, there are hundreds of components in the pool that *can* be rendered. It's a completely dynamic experience.

I don't want to have a massive switch or other conditional construct that lists everything. Although not the nicest this is possible by using the $compile service directly in ng1.

It would be awesome and I know it would solve this problem for a lot of people if there was an easy to use API. I don't want to get away from declarative UI programming but it's not reasonable to expect devs to maintain a switch like declaration with hundreds of code paths.

comment.body: Hi @robwormald, can you improve your plunk or point me to some documentation on how to bind data to these dynamically loaded widgets? Ideally, I want to have two-way binding between container and dynamically loaded child. Thank you in advance.

issue.body:
need some way to change options after showing a dialog. Looked into the source code, not sure how to access the options of $mdDialog.

Thanks

comment.body:
+1
I specifically look for this to be able to _change the closeTo node_ when cancelling a dialog. In my case I'd like to use the same node as openFrom.
Thx
